result.name: provider_led_pathways_to_work_official_statistics
result.notes:
Quarterly statistics on the number of programme starts and job entries for Provider-Led Pathways to Work. Provider-Led Pathways to Work ended in phase 1 districts on 31 March 2011 and ended in phase 2 districts on 27 April 2011. We released the final statistics on Provider-Led Pathways to Work on 25 October 2011 according to the arrangements approved by the UK Statistics Authority.  These publications will show total starts and job entries up to the end of the programme.

https://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/+/http://research.dwp.gov.uk/asd/workingage/p2w_pl.asp

https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/provider-led-pathways-to-work-number-of-starts

Source agency: Work and Pensions

Designation: Official Statistics not designated as National Statistics

Language: English

Alternative title: PL Pathways

organization.name: department-for-work-and-pensions
organization.title: Department for Work and Pensions
organization.description:
The Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) is responsible for welfare and pension policy and is a key player in tackling child poverty. It is the biggest public service delivery department in the UK and serves over 20 million customers.

DWP is a ministerial department, supported by 13 agencies and public bodies.

https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/department-for-work-pensions
